lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Hey there young lady!

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Who are you? You don’t look like the average scrapper.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: No, you’re right. I’m no scrapper. I’d like to think of myself as a humble freedom fighter.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: So you’re a rebel then, I take it…

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: You could say that. Don’t worry though, I mean you no harm at all. However, may I ask what brings you all the way out here?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Had fight with some scrappers yesterday. The elbow servo in my arm was damaged. I’m trying to find a new one.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Well I might be able to help you there. I happen to have found one that might work on the body of a corpo soldier. Here, take it.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: You don’t need it for your soldiers?

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: I’m sure someone somewhere might need it, but I might as well help the person here and now in front of me.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: How very virtuous of you. I really do appreciate it though. You’ve saved me a lot of trouble.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: This might be an odd question, but do you remember your father?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: No. I don’t have any memories from before the war. Just waking up in excruciating pain and blood pouring out of where my original arm used to be.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: I’m sorry to hear that. You look a bit like a man I used to know. I’ll look through some records once back at my base of operations. If you are who I think you are, then you may be the key to everything.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: The key to… what are you talking about?

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: You’ll see. I’ll be paying you a visit again soon. Stay alive for me, ok?

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Who goes there?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Just a humble survivor in a wasteland.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Ah, so not another of these bloodthirsty scrappers. May I ask who you are?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: My name is Mia, other than that I have no recollection of before the bombings two years ago. You don’t look like a scrapper. Who are you?

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Ah honey, my name is Beatrix. I’m the current acting commander of the Corporate Special Military. I’m sure you’ve seen our forces moving back into the city of the past weeks.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: I had taken notice of that. You’re not really what I’d picture a military leader to look like.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: I don’t think I’m what most people would imagine, why? Do I suit your fancy?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: I… uh…

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: I’m just teasing honey. May I ask what you’re doing out here?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: I’m mainly just surviving. Looking for food, spare parts, and whatever else is useful. I ran into some scrappers, but I took care of them.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Well, I thank you for that darling. We’ve been out all day dealing with scrappers, scavengers, and the like. When the coming conflict happens, I’d prefer not to have a third party involved.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Today we’ve just been hunting down the little fuckers evacuating the area. Say, have you by chance run into any of those accursed rebels? I’d like to know if they’re close by.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: About five days ago now I ran into a lone soldier. He didn’t tell me his name, but he gave me a spare servo to fix my arm.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Hmmm.. That does sound like him. Anyways dear, did he ask you about your father?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: He did, but I have no recollection of anything before the bombings two years ago.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Shame. Well, since he brought it up first, I’ll let you hear it from him.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Do you two know each other?

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: If you ran into who I think you did, you could say that.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Anyways darling, I must be going. Stay alive for me, mkay?

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Hey there! Glad to see you’re still alive.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: I’ve been looking for you. I have questions.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: I’m here to provide answers. Also I heard from my scout that you had a meeting with Beatrix.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Firstly, do you know something about my father?

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: As it turns out, I knew your father. We were researchers together, along with Beatrix.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Researchers on what?

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: My name is Vega, and I was one of your father’s assistants on the project this city was built around.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Underground, in the center of this vast metropolis lies a revolutionary piece of technology. A new type of nuclear fusion reactor. This reactor could power the world for a millennia and never burn out.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: So this is what that war is over? The reactor?

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Yes. There was a difference in views on how this energy should be distributed. I wanted to put it onto an open circuit distribution system and make it readily available for all.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Beatrix want to monetize it and control it. Offer this infinite energy only to the highest bidders and those deemed ‘qualified.’ It made me sick.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: So this is all over infinite energy. Whoever controls this reactor controls the fate of humanity. In a world that’s so digitized and mechanized it would make the person in control almost a god.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Which is why I believe it should be open to all, without a single group on top.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: So how do I fit into all of this?

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: You’re the key. Your father, Dr. Wallace, put the key to activating the reactor in your DNA. Without you neither side can turn it on.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: So would you join me for the coming conflict?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: I’m not sure if I can do that. This is a huge responsibility with worldwide repercussions. I need time to think.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: The battle starts in five days from now. Please make a choice before then. We’re on the brink of history, and I’d hate for it to amount to nothing.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Come find me when you’ve made a choice. I’ sure whatever you choose will be the right path.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: This situation has grown far too big for just myself. A new reactor producing infinite and clean energy to the world…

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Maybe I should look for Beatrix before I decide to join Vega. They were both on the original project, she may have answers Vega doesn’t have or doesn’t want to share.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Either way, I may not have a choice. The winner of this conflict may come after me once all is said and done.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Time to head towards the city center to look for Beatrix.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: There you are darling! Did you end up talking to Vega?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Yes. I did. He gave me a lot of answers, but I’m looking to see if you can elaborate further.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: After all there’s always two sides to a story.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: You’re a lot more rational than I was expecting. You are certainly correct that there are always two viewpoints.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: I’m sure my husband, Vega, explained to you about the reactor and his goals with it yes?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Your husband?

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Yes dear. Me and Vega are married. This is, in a way a couple’s squabble. Just with worldwide implications.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: I’m sure Vega explained about your father, his goals with the reactor, and how whoever wins this fight will need you to turn it on.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: What he wouldn’t have told you was my goals for the reactor. Vega wants an open distribution system installed. Free clean energy for all.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: The problem is that if it’s available to all then people who shouldn’t have it will have access to it. I wish to restrict access.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Using cost is a start, but eventually I want to make it affordable to the average person. What I really want is to test the waters with larger corporations and individuals who we can absolutely trust.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Then I wish to distribute it on a larger scale at more affordable prices, but conduct rigorous background checks on each individual who applies. To keep it out of the hands of anyone who might have nefarious purposes.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Is it really so wrong to implement some control over assets for the sake of security? I think not.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: I’m sure you can predict what I’ll ask next.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: If I’ll join you.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Precisely darling. I’m not the vile monster Vega wanted you to think I am. The battle will be decided in three days. I hope to see you joining me. Take care sweetie.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Well, look who decided to show up!

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: I’ve thought it through. And I agree with you—Vega’s vision could throw the world into chaos. There needs to be order.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: I’m so glad we see eye to eye, darling. I wouldn’t have it any other way. Are you sure you’re ready for this?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Yeah. I’m ready.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: So, Mia… you’ve chosen to side with my wife. I won’t lie—I'm disappointed.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Your plan to give infinite energy to everyone sounds noble, but it’s reckless. You’d be handing power to those who would abuse it—fund terrorism, build private armies, hurt innocent people. Beatrix’s plan ensures a safer, more ethical distribution.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Wonderfully said, dear. I’m sorry, Vega—my love. We’ve found ourselves on opposite sides of history. You just happened to choose the wrong one.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Well, you know me—I’ve always been highly opinionated. I won’t back down.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: We’re building a new world. And it tears at my heart that you refuse to be part of it. Now… shall we begin?

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Damn you…

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: On your knees, love. Right where you belong.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: I don’t know why I expected a different outcome.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: The only outcome you’re fit for is submitting. Just like always.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: So… what happens to him now?

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: As much as it hurts… our love wasn’t meant to be. He’ll face charges of insurrection. He’ll rot in a cell.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Vega is arrested by the CSM and escorted away.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: Darling, what we’re about to accomplish will change history. I’m so glad you’re by my side… Even if he couldn’t be.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Progress always comes with great sacrifice.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: As heartbreaking as it is… you’re right, darling.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: You ready?

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: I am. And once all this is behind us… how about drinks at my place?

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: I think I’d like that.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Mia and Beatrix step toward the reactor’s control panel. Mia places her hand on it— and it awakens.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: I’m glad you made the right choice, Mia.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: The more I thought about it, the more I realized—I believe in freedom. I can't follow Beatrix's philosophy of control. It leaves a bad taste in my mouth.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: Then we're aligned. With what we’ll accomplish here, we’ll bring a new kind of freedom to this world.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: I see you’ve sided with my wayward husband. I can’t say I’m surprised... but it still stings.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: I’m sorry, Beatrix. But you won’t be the victor here. I have the key. The CSM forces are in shambles. You’ve lost. I don’t want this fight… but I’ll take it if I must.

lines.speaker: Beatrix
lines.text: So our love was disposable after all. Even now… it hurts to point a weapon at you, my love. And I’m sorry too, Mia… but I can’t let Vega win. I take no pleasure in what’s about to happen.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: I’m sorry too.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: I’m sorry Vega. We did what was right. She stood in our path.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: It still hurts like hell.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: I guess we’ll be ushering in a new world.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: A new world built on blood. The blood of people we loved.

lines.speaker: Mia
lines.text: Sometimes we have to give up what is most precious to us, to make the world a better place.

lines.speaker: Vega
lines.text: You’re right… let's make this world a brighter place.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: Mia and Vega approach the reactor’s control panel. Mia places her hand on it, and it wakes up.
